summary: Howard Liebengood was a staffer for the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI). He is mentioned in the context of the SSCI's investigation into Cuban intelligence networks and related materials held by the NSA, particularly concerning Antonio Veciana. Liebengood participated in a meeting with NSA officials John C. Wobensmith and Tom Moore, during which an NSA product on Antonio Veciana was reviewed. This led to the SSCI requesting a review of all Cuban material from 1961-1965. He is also listed as a staff personnel certified as meeting security clearance requirements up to TOP SECRET.
significance: Howard Liebengood's significance in the JFK context lies in his role as an SSCI staffer involved in the investigation of potential Cuban connections to the assassination, specifically through the case of Antonio Veciana. His involvement highlights the SSCI's efforts to gather information and review relevant materials held by the NSA during their inquiry.
